other_tests.findings: Verbal IQ was 90, and Performance IQ was 92.
Very low β-galactosidase activity in leukocytes of 5.0 nmol/hr/mg protein (range in GM1 homozygotes: 0.78–8.0) and galactose-containing oligosaccharides in urine.

Mild global cerebral white matter atrophy, faint bilateral putaminal clefts, mild cervicothoracic scoliosis, and abnormal cervical vertebral body morphology with irregularity of the endplates and intervertebral discs.
Reduced tracer uptake in both striata (putamen > striatum).

The patient was a compound heterozygote for a paternally inherited pathogenic variant NM_000404.4(GLB1):c.245C>T p.(Thr82Met) and maternally inherited pathogenic variant NM_000404.4(GLB1):c.335A>C p.(His112Pro).
